page.title: 05Waggoners Wells
page.content: Within a short distance of the A3 trunk road which runs between London and Portsmouth is an area of natural beauty, particularly popular with locals.This area is known as{Waggoners {Wells}and consists of three man-made lakes set in a tributary valley of the {River Wey}and surrounded by deciduous trees with a few pines. Walking up out of the valley the land becomes typically open heath with a cover of fern, heather and gorse.On the path edges there are occasional Bilberry bushes. The lakes have trout and carp and one is for fly-fishing whilst another is for spinning. All the land is owned by the{National Trust.}For people who have travelled there by car there is a car-park.
